results.title: The Camel boy
results.creator_credit: Yoram Gross and Yoram Gross Films
results.brief_description: In Australia’s early days the ship of the desert, the camel, was imported to help explore the harsh interior of this vast continent. Through the wonder of animation and live action ‘The Camel Boy’ takes you back to the beginning of this century for an exciting adventure story based on the actual journeys of explorers in Australia’s outback wilderness. The burning sands of the inland desert and the hurricane lashed waters of the ocean are the setting for this story of friendship between a boy and a camel.

results.title: The Calling
results.creator_credit: Victorian College of the Arts and Lisa Chambers
results.brief_description: Madeline O’Connor is the perfect student and one destined to be a nun (according to her mother and the Sisters around her at school). Madeline has other ideas however and dreams of being a ballerina. She does everything in her power to misbehave and ward off any potential angels that might be tempted to come to her during the night - thus signalling she has been chosen by god. This is an uplifting comedy about ambition and fate.

results.title: The Call of Lourdes
results.brief_description: This film shows people from all around the world visiting the ‘city of miracles’ in the foothills of the Pyrenees. Amongst them are 40,000 of the old, the ill and the crippled who seek relief, if not a cure. The film shows the many pilgrims and tourists, the ceremonies, prayers, the grotto, the mineral springs with special properties and the great churches. Lourdes is the ‘city shrine’ to Saint Bernadette.

results.title: The Caleche driver
results.creator_credit: Roger Blais, ONF | NFB and Raymond Garceau
results.brief_description: Much of the old-world charm of Quebec city can be accredited to the open, horse-drawn carriages in which visitors may explore the city - and to the drivers of these ancient vehicles. In this film we get to know Onesime Lamothe, veteran trooper of Quebec’s historic avenues and ever-ready fountain of knowledge.

results.title: The Cage (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Art of silence: pantomimes with Marcel Marceau and his partner Pierre Verry”.
Allegorical pantomime performed by Marcel Marceau showing a person struggling to escape from confinement- an enclosure of invisible walls. Marceau’s groping movements and final breakthrough, only to find another invisible wall, express mankind’s continuing struggle for enlightenment. Marceau believes that “we have but to walk out of the cage”. Also features his partner Pierre Verry. Suitable for upper secondary school level.

results.title: The Cadillac
results.creator_credit: Robert Clouse Associates, Jerry Fitzgerald, Pete Rodriguez and Robert Clouse
results.brief_description: Tells the story of the father in a Mexican-American family who wins a Cadillac car, forms grandiose plans for its use without regard to his inadequate income, makes himself unpopular by his over-solicitous care of the automobile, but is brought to his senses in a subtly worked out resolution. Uses still picture technique.

results.title: The Cactus: profile of a plant
results.creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Edward C. Harris
results.brief_description: Examines the structure life functions of the cactus in its natural environment by means of close-up time lapse photography. Explains the ability of the cactus to survive in the harsh desert environment.

results.title: The Cactus: adaptations for survival
results.brief_description: This film explains how the cactus has been able to adapt successfully to harsh environments through its unique physical characteristics and lifecycle. Demonstrates its water-conserving characteristics. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: The Cabinet of Dr Caligari [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Erich Pommer, Delca-Bioscop and Robert Wiene
results.brief_description: With psychosis, paranoia and the blurring of the distinction between madness and sanity at its centre, Caligari can be seen thematically as a distant forerunner to the psycho-horror sub genre. A sinister hypnotist, Dr. Caligari, exhibits his creature, a somnambulist named Cesare, at the town fair. When a series of bizarre murders follow, Dr. Caligari is accused of using the somnambulist to commit the murders. A silent masterpiece, “The Cabinet of Dr Caligari” features macabre theatrical-style set designs influenced by German Expressionism. The intention of the filmmakers was to expand the notion of cinema beyond its quest for re-creation of reality. These elaborate and haunting sets serve as a touchstone for the characters’ inner turmoil. This version features the original colourisation with green, brown and blue tints. Cast includes Werner Krauss, Conrad Veidt, Friedrich Feher, Lil Dagover, Rudolf Lettinger.
